radiographic_examinations.findings: Narrowing of the distal third of the esophagus, deviation to the left, and smooth mucosa with proximal esophagus dilation.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Heterogeneous soft-tissue mass (4.0 cm) adjacent to the distal esophagus, gastrohepatic and subcarinal lymphadenopathy, and numerous nodules in the right lung.

Large metabolically active paraesophageal mass of lymph nodes, increased uptake of 18F-FDG in lymph nodes, multiple scattered lung nodules, focus of 18F-FDG uptake in T1 vertebra, and sclerotic bone lesion in L4 vertebra.

radiographic_examinations.date: 12 weeks after the start of crizotinib therapy
radiographic_examinations.findings: Decreased size of the paraesophageal lymph-node mass and subcarinal lymph nodes.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreased size of the lesions, overall response meets criteria for a partial response.

radiographic_examinations.date: Before and after treatment with crizotinib
radiographic_examinations.findings: Increased radio-tracer uptake in T1 and L4 metastases before treatment.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement noted in the T1 and L4 metastases after treatment.
